method1_output:
Kuna hadithi nyingi kuhusu viboko katika tamaduni mbalimbali. Moja ya hadithi hizo ni kwamba viboko walikuwa wakifanya kazi kwa bidii sana maeneo ya mashambani na hawakuwa na muda wa kupumzika au kujifurahisha.

Siku moja, viboko walikasirika sana kwa sababu walikuwa wakifanya kazi kwa muda mrefu na hawakuwa wakijaliwa chochote kwa ajili ya shughuli yao ngumu. Walimwomba Mungu awapatie nafasi ya kupumzika na kujifurahisha.

Mungu akawasikiliza na akawapa nafasi ya kutembea katika msitu. Hata hivyo, viboko walikwenda mbali sana katika msitu huo na wakachelewa kurejea kazini kwa wakati unaofaa. Walipofika kazini kuchelewa, mkubwa wao alionyesha hasira kubwa na kuwapa viboko hao adhabu ya kipigo kikali.

Baada ya adhabu hiyo, viboko walirudi nyumbani wakiwa wameumizwa na kusononeka. Walihuzunika sana kwamba walikuwa wakifanya kazi kwa bidii sana bila kupata chochote kwa ajili ya shughuli yao ngumu.

Mungu aliwajali na alianza kuwapa zawadi za asili ili kuwasaidia katika shughuli zao za kila siku. Aliwapa viboko nguvu nyingi zaidi na uwezo wa kupasua mti kwa kung'oa kasha. Hii ilifanya kazi yao iwe rahisi sana na kuwa na muda wa kujifurahisha na kupumzika. Walikuwa na nguvu sana na kuweza kufanya kazi kwa haraka na kwa ufanisi.

Hadi leo, viboko wanachukuliwa kama alama ya nguvu na uwezo katika tamaduni mbalimbali. Hadithi hii inafundisha umuhimu wa kudai haki yetu na kutunzana sisi kama wanyama wote.
****************English Meaning****************
There are many stories about baboons in various cultures. One of these stories is that baboons used to work very hard in rural areas and did not have time to rest or enjoy themselves.

One day, the baboons became very angry because they had been working for a long time and were not rewarded for their hard work. They asked God to give them a chance to rest and have fun.

God listened to them and gave them the opportunity to walk in the forest. However, the baboons went too far into the forest and were late in returning to work. When they arrived late, their boss showed great anger and gave the baboons a severe beating.

After the punishment, the baboons returned home feeling hurt and disappointed. They were very sad that they had been working so hard without getting anything for their hard work.

God cared for them and began to give them natural gifts to help them in their daily work. He gave the baboons more strength and the ability to split a tree by pulling out the bark. This made their work much easier and gave them time to relax and rest. They were very strong and able to work quickly and efficiently.

To this day, baboons are considered a symbol of strength and ability in various cultures. This story teaches the importance of demanding our rights and taking care of all animals.
method2_step1_output: Please tell a story about whips.
method2_step2_output:
Once upon a time in a far-off land, there lived a young boy named Jack who was fascinated with whips. His father, a farm worker, often took him to the fields, where he watched the men use whips to control cattle.

As Jack grew older, he became more and more interested in mastering the art of using whips. However, his father discouraged him, saying it was a dangerous activity, and he should focus on his studies instead.

But Jack couldn't resist his fascination with whips. He secretly saved up his pocket money and bought himself a whip from a local blacksmith. He would sneak off to the fields to practice, slowly perfecting his technique.

One day, while he was practicing, a group of cattle suddenly came charging towards him. Without thinking twice, Jack flicked his whip and let out a loud crack. The cattle immediately stopped in their tracks, surprised by the sound.

The farmers who witnessed this were amazed. They had never seen such control and precision with a whip before. Jack was hailed as a prodigy, and soon he was hired to work on the farm, dedicated to training the other farmworkers in the art of using whips.

As the years went by, Jack's skill with the whip became legendary, and he became known as the best whiphandler in all the land. He passed his knowledge down to his own children, who followed in his footsteps, ensuring that the art of using whips was never lost.

And so, the humble whip – once dismissed as a simple tool – became a valuable asset for the farmers, and Jack's passion for it had transformed him into a master of his craft.
method2_final_output:
Siku moja katika nchi ya mbali, kulikuwa na mvulana mdogo aliyeitwa Jack ambaye alikuwa anavutiwa sana na matambara. Baba yake, mfanyakazi wa shamba, mara nyingi alimpeleka shambani, ambapo alimwona wanaume wakitumia matambara kuwaongoza mifugo.

Jack alipozidi kukua, alivutiwa zaidi na zaidi na kujifunza kutumia matambara. Hata hivyo, baba yake alimzuia, akisema kuwa ilikuwa ni shughuli hatari, na angependa aelekeze nguvu zake katika masomo.

Lakini Jack hakuweza kuzuia kuvutiwa kwake na matambara. Aliokoa pesa zake za mfukoni kwa siri na kununua tambara kutoka kwa seremala wa eneo lao. Angepotea shambani kujifunza, akiboresha ujuzi wake taratibu.

Siku moja, alipokuwa anajifunza, kundi la mifugo ghafla ilianza kukimbia kwa kasi kuelekea kwake. Bila kufikiri mara mbili, Jack aliruka na kutupa tambara na kupiga mshindo mkubwa. Mifugo mara moja ilisimama kwa kutatizwa na sauti hiyo.

Wakulima walioshuhudia hili walishangazwa. Hawakuwahi kuona udhibiti na usahihi kwa kutumia matambara kabla. Jack alikuwa kipenzi, na kwa hivi karibuni alikodishwa kufanya kazi kwenye shamba, kujitolea kufundisha wafanyakazi wengine kuhusu matumizi ya matambara.

Miaka ilipita, ujuzi wa Jack na matambara yalipata sifa kubwa, na akawa anajulikana kama mtumiaji bora wa matambara katika nchi yote. Alipitisha elimu yake kwa watoto wake wenyewe, ambao waliendelea kuwa wazuri kama yeye, kuhakikisha kuwa sanaa ya matambara haipotei.

Na hivyo, matambara ya kawaida - ambayo hapo awali yalitupwa kama chombo cha kawaida - ilikuwa mali yenye thamani kwa wakulima, na shauku ya Jack ilimgeuza kuwa bwana wa sanaa hiyo.

input: Tafadhali toa mpango wa mapambo ya ndani katika mtindo wa Nordic.
method1_output:
Mpango wa mapambo ya ndani katika mtindo wa Nordic ni pamoja na mambo yafuatayo:

1. Rangi: Chagua rangi zenye utulivu kama nyeupe, kijivu na bluu. Rangi hizi zinaipa nafasi chumba kuonekana kubwa zaidi na kupunguza msongamano.

2. Nuru: Haina budi kuwa ya asili iwezekanavyo. Chagua vitambaa vyenye mwanga na mabano kubwa ili kuzuia mwanga usiotakiwa kuingia.

3. Mbao: Tumia mbao kwa matumizi ya sakafu na samani. Mbao inaonekana nzuri ikiwa haijapakwa rangi.

4. Samani: Tumia samani zenye muundo rahisi na safi. Samani hizi zinapaswa kuwa rahisi na safi lakini zenye kujaa utu.

5. Vipodozi: Anza na vifaa vyenye muundo wa Scandinavian maarufu kama 'hygge' kama vile kupamba pamba za kitani, magongo laini na mito wasifu ya mnene.

6. Vitu vya kufurahisha: Ongeza vitu vya kufurahisha kama vile mishumaa, vitambaa vya kitani, na mishumaa ya kitani kwenye chumba ili kuunda mazingira ya utulivu.

7. Nyanya: Tumia nyanya kama sehemu ya mapambo kama vile rakini, mistari, na mipira. Haijalishi umechagua muundo wa msingi, uweka uaminifu wa uchoraji wa kitani na mtindo.

8. Ukuta: Tumia bango lenye usanifu katika rangi nyeupe au nyeupe na mstari mwembamba wa kuweka utulivu.

9. Vifaa vya uendeshaji: Chagua vifaa vyenye rangi safi na vya kitani katika rangi ya fedha au rangi ya shaba kuchangia mtindo wa Scandinavian. 

Kwa ujumla, mpango wa mapambo ya ndani katika mtindo wa Nordic unahusu nafasi zenye usafi, zenye utulivu, na zenye usanifu. Uweke uzito kwenye hali ya kuishi na kuhakikisha kuwa chochote unachochagua kinaonekana safi, rahisi, na zenye utu.
****************English Meaning****************
The interior decoration plan in Nordic style includes the following:

1. Color: Choose calming colors such as white, gray, and blue. These colors help the room appear larger and reduce clutter.

2. Lighting: Use as much natural light as possible. Choose fabrics with light colors and large curtains to control unwanted light.

3. Wood: Use wood for floors and furniture. Wood looks great unpainted.

4. Furniture: Use simple and clean designs for furniture. The furniture should be simple and clean but still have character.

5. Accessories: Start with Scandinavian design accessories like linen cushions, soft blankets, and thick knit throws.

6. Decorative items: Add decorative items such as candles, linen towels, and candles in the room to create a calm atmosphere.

7. Plants: Use plants as part of decorations such as racks, lines, and balls. No matter what design you choose, maintain the integrity of the fabric painting and style.

8. Wall: Use an architecturally-designed white or white sign with a thin line to maintain calmness.

9. Functional accessories: Choose clean-colored and cotton-colored accessories in silver or brass color to contribute to the Scandinavian style.

Overall, the Nordic interior decoration plan is about clean, calm, and architectural spaces. Focus on livability and make sure whatever you choose looks clean, simple, and with character.
method2_step1_output: Please provide a plan for interior decoration in the Nordic style.
method2_step2_output:
1. Color Scheme: Select neutral colors for walls and floors such as white, black, gray, or light blue. Use pops of color like yellow, red, or green in fabrics, artwork, and small decor items.

2. Furniture: Choose simple furniture designs in natural materials like wood, leather, or linen. Look for clean lines and functional pieces that make efficient use of space.

3. Lighting: Create a warm and cozy atmosphere by using soft, diffused lighting. Use floor lamps, table lamps, and pendant fixtures to create layers of light in the room.

4. Textures: Add texture to a room through textiles like wool or knitted throws, sheepskin rugs, and linen or cotton fabrics. These textures add warmth and coziness to the room.

5. Artwork and Decor: Choose artwork and decor pieces that are simple and minimalist in design while evoking a sense of nature and the outdoors. Add planters with low maintenance plants such as succulents and cacti.

6. Accessories: Use natural materials such as wood or stone to display unique accessories such as bowls or sculptures.

7. Minimalism: Keep decoration and furniture minimal, ensuring an uncluttered and calming atmosphere.

8. Functionality: Always design with functionality in mind. Choose storage solutions that maximize space such as open shelves, storage boxes, and cabinets.

9. Variation: Add visual interest by varying heights, textures, and colors, and don’t be afraid to mix patterns and materials while keeping the overall color scheme in mind.

10. Balancing Scale: Always balance the scale of your decor to your furniture and accent items, taking care not to overwhelm the space.
method2_final_output:
1. Mpangilio wa rangi: Chagua rangi za asili za kupaua na sakafu kama nyeupe, nyeusi, kijivu, au buluu mwanga. Tumia rangi kama ya manjano, nyekundu, au kijani kwenye vitambaa, sanaa, na vitu vidogo vya mapambo.

2. Samani: Chagua muundo wa samani wa kawaida kwa vifaa vya asili kama vile kuni, ngozi, au kitani. Tafuta mistari safi na vipande vya kazi vinavyotumia nafasi kwa ufanisi.

3. Taa: Unda mazingira ya joto na starehe kwa kutumia taa laini na inayotambaa. Tumia taa za sakafu, taa za mezani, na taa za pendant ili kuunda safu za mwanga ndani ya chumba.

4. Muundo: Ongeza muundo kwenye chumba kupitia vitambaa kama mikono ya sufi au kitambaa cha kitani au pamba. Muundo huu unakuza joto na starehe ndani ya chumba.

5. Sanaa na mapambo: Chagua sanaa na vitu vya mapambo ambavyo ni rahisi na wigo mdogo lakini huchochea hisia za asili na nje. Ongeza mitalimwengu wenye mimea isiyo na haja ya utunzaji kama vile michirizi na mikate-te.

6. Vifaa: Tumia vifaa vyenye asili kama kuni au mawe kuonyesha vitu bunifu kama vikombe au sanamu.

7. Uchache: Weka mapambo na samani kuwa machache, kuhakikisha kuwa kuna mazingira safi na kutuliza.

8. Utendaji: Panga kila kitu kwa kutumia utendaji katika akili. Chagua suluhisho za uhifadhi ambazo zinachochea nafasi kama rafu wazi, sanduku la uhifadhi, na makabati.

9. Mabadiliko: Ongeza hamu ya macho kwa kubadilisha urefu, miundo, na rangi, na usiogope kupata muundo na vifaa tofauti wakati bado unaweka akilini mpangilio wa rangi ya jumla.

10. Ulinganifu wa Kipimo: Daima sawazisha kipimo cha vitu vyako na samani na vitu vidogo vya mapambo, ukitunza nafasi iliyo wazi hewani.

input: Tafadhali tekeleza algorithm ya Support Vector Machine kwa kutumia Python.
method1_output:
Hapa kuna skeleton code kwa ajili ya kuendesha algorithm ya Support Vector Machine kwa kutumia Python:

```
from sklearn.svm import SVC
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score, precision_score, recall_score

# Load the dataset
X_train, y_train, X_test, y_test = ... (load your dataset here)

# Create the SVM classifier object
svc = SVC(kernel='linear', C=1, gamma='auto')

# Train the SVM classifier
svc.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Make predictions on the test set
y_pred = svc.predict(X_test)

# Calculate the evaluation metrics
acc = accuracy_score(y_test, y_pred)
prec = precision_score(y_test, y_pred)
rec = recall_score(y_test, y_pred)

# Print the evaluation metrics
print("Accuracy:", acc)
print("Precision:", prec)
print("Recall:", rec)
```

Kumbuka kwamba kuna maelekezo kwa ajili ya algorithm ya Support Vector Machine kwenye scipy.org. Pia unaweza kutumia GridSearchCV kwa ajili ya kuongeza C na gamma optimization maelekezo.
****************English Meaning****************
Here is a skeleton code for running the Support Vector Machine algorithm using Python:

```
from sklearn.svm import SVC
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score, precision_score, recall_score

# Load the dataset
X_train, y_train, X_test, y_test = ... (load your dataset here)

# Create the SVM classifier object
svc = SVC(kernel='linear', C=1, gamma='auto')

# Train the SVM classifier
svc.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Make predictions on the test set
y_pred = svc.predict(X_test)

# Calculate the evaluation metrics
acc = accuracy_score(y_test, y_pred)
prec = precision_score(y_test, y_pred)
rec = recall_score(y_test, y_pred)

# Print the evaluation metrics
print("Accuracy:", acc)
print("Precision:", prec)
print("Recall:", rec)
```

Note that there are instructions for the Support Vector Machine algorithm on scipy.org. You can also use GridSearchCV to optimize C and gamma.
method2_step1_output: Please implement the Support Vector Machine algorithm using Python.
method2_step2_output:
Sure, here is the implementation of Support Vector Machine algorithm using Python:

```python
from sklearn import svm
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

# Loading the dataset
iris = pd.read_csv('https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/machine-learning-databases/iris/iris.data')
iris.columns = ['Sepal_Length', 'Sepal_Width', 'Petal_Length', 'Petal_Width', 'Class']
iris.dropna(how="all", inplace=True) # remove any empty rows

# Convert categorical values to numerical
iris["Class"] = pd.factorize(iris.Class)[0]
X = iris.iloc[:, :-1] # features
y = iris.iloc[:, -1] # target variable

# Splitting dataset into training and testing
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size=0.3,random_state=109) # 70% training and 30% test

# Create a SVM Classifier
clf = svm.SVC(kernel='linear') # Linear Kernel

# Train the model using the training sets
clf.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict the response for test dataset
y_pred = clf.predict(X_test)

# Evaluation of the model
from sklearn import metrics
# Model Accuracy: how often is the classifier correct?
print("Accuracy:",metrics.accuracy_score(y_test, y_pred))

# Model Precision: what percentage of positive tuples are labeled as such?
print("Precision:",metrics.precision_score(y_test, y_pred))

# Model Recall: what percentage of positive tuples are labelled as such?
print("Recall:",metrics.recall_score(y_test, y_pred))
```

In this implementation, we have used SVM with a linear kernel to classify the Iris dataset. The dataset is loaded into a Pandas dataframe, and then converted to numerical format. The data is then split into training and testing datasets, and a Support Vector Machine classifier is created. The model is then trained using the training data and tested against the testing set. Finally, the accuracy, precision, and recall of the model are evaluated using the metrics module from sklearn.
method2_final_output:
Hakika, hapa ni utekelezaji wa algorithm ya Machine ya vecta ya Msaada kwa kutumia Python:

```python
from sklearn import svm
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

# Kupakia dataset
iris = pd.read_csv('https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/machine-learning-databases/iris/iris.data')
iris.columns = ['Urefu_Wa_Sepal', 'Upana_Wa_Sepal', 'Urefu_Wa_Petal', 'Upana_Wa_Petal', 'Aina']
iris.dropna(how="all", inplace=True) # kuondoa safu tupu

# Kubadilisha thamani za kikundi cha aina hadi nambari
iris["Aina"] = pd.factorize(iris.Aina)[0]
X = iris.iloc[:, :-1] # vipengele
y = iris.iloc[:, -1] # lengo

# Weka dataset kwa sehemu ya mafunzo na ya majaribio
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size=0.3,random_state=109) # 70% mafunzo na 30% majaribio

# Unda mchambuzi ya SVM
clf = svm.SVC(kernel='linear') # muafaka wa safu ya Linear

# Fanya mafunzo ya mfano kwa kutumia seti ya mafunzo
clf.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Tabiri jibu kwa dataset ya majaribio
y_pred = clf.predict(X_test)

# Tathmini mfano
from sklearn import metrics
# Uwiano wa mfano: mara ngapi mchambuzi hufanya sahihi?
print("Uwiano:",metrics.accuracy_score(y_test, y_pred))

# Ufanisi wa mfano: asilimia ngapi ya tupu chanya zimeainishwa kama hizo?
print("Ufanisi:",metrics.precision_score(y_test, y_pred))

# Kukumbuka kwa mfano: asilimia ngapi ya tupu chanya zimeainishwa kama hizo?
print("Kukumbuka:",metrics.recall_score(y_test, y_pred))
```

Katika utekelezaji huu, tumetumia SVM na muafaka wa safu ya Linear ili kugawanya dataset ya Iris. Dataset imewekwa kwenye dataframe ya Pandas, na kisha ikabadilishwa kuwa nambari. Data kisha imegawanywa kwa sehemu ya mafunzo na ya majaribio, na mchambuzi wa vecta ya Msaada kisha imeundwa. Mfano huo umejifunza kwa kutumia data ya mafunzo na kupimwa dhidi ya seti ya majaribio. Hatimaye, uwiano, ufanisi, na kukumbuka kwa mfano huo hupimwa kwa kutumia moduli ya metrics kutoka sklearn.

input: Tafadhali andika kichwa kinachotokana na yaliyomo hapa chini: CBA Yanapiga Faini Timu Mbili na Makocha kwa "Mchezo Mbaya" kwenye Mashindano. Tarehe 17 Aprili, Chama cha Mpira wa Kikapu cha China kilifanya mkutano na waandishi wa habari ambao walitangaza adhabu kwa Timu za Mpira wa kikapu za Shanghai Jushilong Lions na Suzhou Kenitex. Timu hizo zilikabiliwa na adhabu kutokana na "mchezo mbaya" wakati wa mechi mbili muhimu kwenye mashindano ya CBA. Kama matokeo, CBA ilifuta nafasi na ushiriki wa timu hizo mbili kwa msimu huo na kupunguza ufadhili wa ligi yao kwa yuan 5 milioni. Makocha wa timu husika pia walikabiliwa na adhabu, Li Chunjiang na Li Nan, makocha wakuu wa Shanghai Jushilong na Suzhou Kenitex mtawalia, walipoteza leseni zao za ufundishaji kwa miaka mitano na mitatu. Shilinjie, mkurugenzi mkuu wa Kenitex na Jiang Yusheng, mkurugenzi mkuu wa Jushilong, pia walikabiliwa na kusimamishwa kwa miaka mitano na mitatu mtawalia. Kulingana na ratiba ya asili, raundi ya pili ya mashindano ya CBA msimu huu ilikuwa inatarajiwa kuanza usiku huo kwa mechi kati ya Shenzhen Marco Polo na Shanghai Jushilong. Walakini, kama matokeo ya marufuku, Shenzhen Marco Polo alipata nafasi ya moja kwa moja kwenye nusu fainali. Zhang Xiong, Mkurugenzi Mtendaji wa CBA, alielezea kuwa adhabu zilikuwa kwa mujibu wa kanuni za nidhamu za ligi na zilikuwa zinategemea kiwango na utambuzi wa uvunjaji. Yao Ming, Mwenyekiti wa CBA, pia alielezea masikitiko yake kuhusu adhabu hizo, akisisitiza umuhimu wa uadilifu katika michezo zaidi ya ustadi. Alikuwa na matumaini kwamba kupitia tukio hili, ligi inaweza kubadilika kwa bora na kuunda matokeo zaidi yenye thamani.
method1_output:
CBA Yanapiga Faini Timu Mbili na Makocha kwa "Mchezo Mbaya" kwenye Mashindano ya Mpira wa Kikapu nchini China.
****************English Meaning****************
CBA fines two teams and coaches for "Unsportsmanlike conduct" in basketball tournament in China.
method2_step1_output: Please write a headline that summarizes the content below: CBA fines two teams and coaches for "dirty play" in tournament. On April 17, the Chinese Basketball Association held a press conference where they announced penalties for the basketball teams Shanghai Jushilong Lions and Suzhou Kenitex. The teams were penalized for "dirty play" during two important matches in the CBA tournament. As a result, CBA eliminated the two teams from the season and reduced the league's funding by 5 million yuan. The coaches of the teams were also punished; both Li Chunjiang and Li Nan, head coaches of Shanghai Jushilong and Suzhou Kenitex respectively, lost their coaching licenses for five and three years. Shilinjie, the CEO of Kenitex, and Jiang Yusheng, the CEO of Jushilong, were also suspended for five and three years, respectively. According to the original schedule, the second round of this season's CBA tournament was expected to begin that night with a match between Shenzhen Marco Polo and Shanghai Jushilong. However, due to the ban, Shenzhen Marco Polo received a direct spot in the semifinals. Zhang Xiong, CEO of CBA, explained that the penalties were in accordance with the league's disciplinary rules and depended on the level of violation. Yao Ming, Chairman of CBA, also expressed his regret about the penalties, emphasizing the importance of integrity in sports beyond skill. He hoped that through this incident, the league could change for the better and create more valuable results.
method2_step2_output: Chinese Basketball Association Fines Two Teams and Coaches for "Dirty Play" in Tournament
method2_final_output: Shirikisho la Mpira wa Kikapu la Uchina Lashtaki Timu Mbili na Makocha kwa "Uchezaji Mchafu" katika Mashindano.
